title: After TCS, Infosys mulls buyback worth $2.5 billion, official announcement likely in April: Report
text:
After TCS, Infosys mulls buyback worth $2.5 billion, official announcement likely in April: Report After TCS, Infosys mulls buyback worth $2.5 billion, official announcement likely in April: Report After TCS, Infosys on Thursday reportedly said that it is actively mulling buyback and will kickstart the process soon. By: FE Online | Updated: February 23, 2017 3:23 PM Sources alos revealed that Infosys founders have agreed on share buyback and they will not oppose it. 
After TCS, Infosys on Thursday reportedly said that it is actively mulling buyback and will kickstart the process soon. Sources told ET Now, “Size of Infosys buyback likely to be over $2.5 billion and the official buyback announcement will be likely in April”. Sources alos revealed that Infosys founders have agreed on share buyback and they will not oppose it. “The board has given nod to adopt new Articles of Association to incorporate buyback,” they told the business news channel. Infosys – India’s second largest information technology services company – has cash worth Rs 38,000 crore on its books, which it may find difficult to deploy in an acquisition. 
Hailing TCS buyback earlier this month, TV Mohandas Pai on Thursday said “I hope that Infosys follows suit and announces share buyback.” “If Cognizant and TCS can buyback shares, why not Infosys?” he added. Earlier last month, Infosys reported its consolidated net profit for the third quarter of the current financial year 2016-17 rose 2.3% on-quarter to Rs 37.08 billion, beating most analyst estimates and sending shares soaring.
